Can it be claimed that the entire%0D%0AUmmah is misguided?%0D%0A%0D%0AThe fallacy of the second (concept) belief i.e. obedience of the Holy%0D%0AProphet is binding upon the Sahaba (RA) only, is evident and exposed that%0D%0Aneeds no further elaboration. "Blessed is the one%0D%0Awho revealed the Furqaan that he may be a warner to the worlds".%0D%0A%0D%0AAnother question that arises with this concept is: Are the Sahaba who%0D%0Awitnessed the revelation of the Noble Qur%E3n more in need of its explanation%0D%0Aor are the ones that came after them more in need?%0D%0A%0D%0AThe third concept is also totally unacceptable because the Quran has reached%0D%0Aus through the same method as the Ahaadith have reached us. There existed no real need%0D%0Afor this as the Sahaba memorised virtually every word spoken by the Holy%0D%0AProphet (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam). Allah Ta'ala had granted them such%0D%0Aperfect and excellent memories that once they heard anything they used to%0D%0Aremember it throughout their lives. Once%0D%0AHazrat Ibn Umar (RA) repeated Ahaadith to a bedouin, in order for him to%0D%0Amemorize it well. The bedouin remarked, "Enough, once is sufficient I shall%0D%0Anot forget it till death. I have performed 60 pilgrimages on 60 camels and I%0D%0Aknow perfectly well which Hajj I performed on which camel."%0D%0A%0D%0AThis was the condition of the bedouins in ordinary matters and mundane talk.%0D%0AHow much more did they preserve the speech of Rasulullah (Sallallaahu Alayhi%0D%0AWasallam). Not only his speech but every action notion, indication,%0D%0Aapproval, disapproval and deed of Rasulullah (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam)%0D%0Awas preserved by them. They valued these more than their lives and wealth.%0D%0AThey used to alternate with their business partners in sitting in the%0D%0Agathering of the Holy Prophet (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam). Each partner%0D%0Aused to narrate to his companion what he had heard the Holy Prophet%0D%0A(Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) say. Extreme measures were taken to safeguard%0D%0Athe words of the Holy Prophet (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam). Many of them%0D%0A(did not know how to write) were not literate. The%0D%0AAhaadith were recorded in the presence of the Holy Prophet (Sallallaahu%0D%0AAlayhi Wasallam)%0D%0A%0D%0ATHE PROHIBITION OF RECORDING HADITH AND ITS ANSWER%0D%0AThe Holy Prophet (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) has mentioned in one Hadith,%0D%0A'Do not record (write) from me anything except the Quran. Whosoever has%0D%0Awritten anything should obliterate it. (Muslim vol.2 Pg.44)%0D%0A%0D%0AThis prohibition is of a temporary nature when the Quran was initially being%0D%0Arevealed (and there was a possibility of the hadith and Quran being mixed%0D%0Aup) so that the hadith and the Quran do not get mixed up. When this initial%0D%0Aperiod has passed and this possibility was ruled out, this prohibition%0D%0Aceased and an order was given to write and record the Ahaadith as Allama%0D%0AIbne-Hajar has detailed in his commentary on Bukhari Shareef. Allama Nawawi%0D%0Ain the commentary of Muslim Shareef has stated that the prohibition was when%0D%0Athe mixing was feared. Thereafter when it was safe, permission was granted%0D%0Afor writing.%0D%0A%0D%0ATHE THREE METHODS OF PRESERVING AND SAFEGUARDING THE HADITH%0D%0AWe hereby detail all the methods utilised to preserve Ahaadith from the%0D%0Aprophetic era upto this day. There is consensus that recording and writing%0D%0Awas not the only method of safeguarding Ahaadith. There existed other%0D%0Areliable methods as well:%0D%0A%0D%0A1. MEMORISING THE AHAADITH%0D%0AThe most reliable method adopted by the Sahaaba (RA) to safeguard the%0D%0AAhaadith was through memory.%0D%0A%0D%0A2. PRESERVATION THROUGH ACTION AND PRACTICE%0D%0AThis was another reliable means of protecting and safeguarding the Ahaadith.%0D%0AThe Sahaaba (RA) used to transform the words of Rasulullah (Sallallaahu%0D%0AAlayhi Wasallam) into action immediately and every Sahaabi used to practice%0D%0Aupon the Hadith. Therefore, many traditions contact the phrases:%0D%0A"This is how I saw the Holy Prophet (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) carry out%0D%0Aand perform this."%0D%0A%0D%0AThis practical method was very effective in preserving the Ahaadith. It is%0D%0Acontinuing upto this day.%0D%0A%0D%0A3. WRITING AND RECORDING THE HADITH%0D%0AThis method was also customary in the prophetic era. This procedure had%0D%0Apassed through four stages (phases)%0D%0A%0D%0A1. Recording of Ahaadith without any arrangement or sequence%0D%0A2. Arranging the Ahaadith relating to certain subject (topic) or subjects%0D%0Ainto one small book%0D%0A3. Accumulating of various Ahaadith into one book.%0D%0A4. Compiling Ahaadith and codifying.%0D%0A%0D%0AThe first two types of compiling were extensively practised during the time%0D%0Aof the Prophet (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) and the Sahaba (RA). The%0D%0Afollowing details will suffice for the Rejectors of Hadith.%0D%0A%0D%0A1. Imam Tirmidhi has included a special chapter in the Chapter of knowledge%0D%0Atitled, The chapter of the permissibility of recording Hadith - Hazrat Abu%0D%0AHurrairah (RA) reports that the Holy Prophet indicated to a certain Ansari%0D%0ASahabi whose memory was weak, to write. One Ansari Sahabi (RA) used to sit%0D%0Aby Rasulullah (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) and listen to the Hadith; it%0D%0Aused to please him, but he was unable to memorise it. He complained to the%0D%0AHoly Prophet (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) who replied, "Seek assistance%0D%0Awith your right hand and he indicated towards writing with his hand (Jamia%0D%0ATirmizi vol. 2 pg. 107).%0D%0A2. In a tradition recorded in Mustadrak-e-Haakim, Hazrat Amr bin Aas (R.A.)%0D%0Areports, 'I used to record everything the Holy Prophet (Sallallaahu Alayhi%0D%0AWasallam) used to say with an incitation of (accumility) and gathering same.%0D%0AThe Quraish stopped me saying: "Do you write everything the Holy Prophet%0D%0A(Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) says? Hadhrat Abdullah bin Amr (Radhiallaahu %C1nhu) possessed a collection%0D%0Athat exceeded one thousand Ahaadith. Ibnr-Rushd has mentioned in his Kitaab%0D%0AAsadul Ghaaba (vol. 3 pg. 233) that, this collection was named As-saadiqah.%0D%0A%0D%0A2. KITABUS - SAQAH%0D%0AThis collection was personally dictated by the Holy Prophet (Sallallaahu%0D%0AAlayhi Wasallam). It contained details regarding Zakaat, Ushar etc.%0D%0AAccording to some reports it seems as though this was written for the Zakaat%0D%0Acollectors. Hadhrat Abu Hurayra%0D%0Adenied the Hadith. Hadhrat Hassan told him, 'I have narrated this Hadith%0D%0Afrom you'. There are many other small Sahifas which the holy Prophet (Sallallaahu%0D%0AAlayhi Wasallam) sent to the kings; and, other compilations which have been%0D%0Aomitted for the sake of brevity.%0D%0A%0D%0ATHE ERA OF HADHRAT UMAR BIN ABDUL AZIZ%0D%0AThough the writing of the Ahaadith had commenced it was not done in an%0D%0Aarranged manner, i.e. it was compiled and codified. Due to the%0D%0Apre-occupations of the Khulafaa-e-Raashideen with the compilation of the%0D%0ANoble Qur%E3n and other important matters, it was not possible for them to%0D%0Aaccomplish this task.%0D%0A%0D%0AHowever, when the politicians at the time of Hazrat Ali (R.A.) began to%0D%0Afabricate false Ahaadith Hazrat Ali became concerned about safeguarding the%0D%0Aauthentic Ahaadith. A large collection of Ahaadith were compiled in this manner%0D%0Ain the first century.%0D%0A1. Hafiz Ibn Abdul Bar has written that Qazi Abu Bakr has compiled many%0D%0Abooks on Ahaadith called "Books of Abu Bakr."%0D%0A2. The Risala (Booker) of Saalim ibn Abdullah on Sadaqaat.%0D%0A3. Compiling had began in the time of the Sahaba (R.A.) especially in the%0D%0Atime of Hazrat Ali (R.A.);%0D%0A4.
